intro: Lasiosiphon insularis, commonly known as the island lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to the island of St. Helena. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Lasiosiphon insularis is a rare species, highlighting its ecological significance on the island.
